connect4.network.server

Class Buffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • connect4.network.server.Buffer

  • public class Buffer
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Buffer()
      Makes a new Buffer which is empty.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the buffer is empty, false if it is not.
      java.lang.String readBuffer()
      Reads one string from the buffer and sets isEmpty to true if it was the only string.
      void writeBuffer(java.lang.String string)
      Writes a String to the buffer, if it was empty before set isEmpty to false.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Buffer

        public Buffer()
        Makes a new Buffer which is empty.

    • Method Detail

      • readBuffer

        public java.lang.String readBuffer()
        Reads one string from the buffer and sets isEmpty to true if it was the only string. Will read at first index and remove the first index. All elements will be shifted to the left.
        Returns:
        String that was stored

      • writeBuffer

        public void writeBuffer(java.lang.String string)
        Writes a String to the buffer, if it was empty before set isEmpty to false.
        Parameters:
        string - - The string you want to store in the buffer

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the buffer is empty, false if it is not.
        Returns:
        true if empty, false if not empty
